hours_text:
## VISIT

## THE MUSEUM

## Hours & Admission

### Opening Hours

Office: Monday-Friday 8:00am – 4:00pm

Exhibits: Thursday – Sunday 10:00am – 4:00pm

The hours above reflect the Museum’s regular operating schedule. These may be affected by private event rentals, special Museum events, park closures, etc. For information on Museum availability on a specific date, please contact us.

The Museum is located in Micke Grove Park but is a separate entity with its own admission cost, policies, and availability. For information on Park hours and amenities or access to and rental of Park facilities, visit the Micke Grove Park website [HERE](https://www.sjparks.com/parks/micke-grove-regional-park.aspx) or call (209) 331-7400.

### Holidays/cLOSURES

The Museum will be closed from December 24, 2024 through January 1, 2025. Happy Holidays to those who celebrate! 

### RESEARCH

Access to the Museum’s archives and research library is by appointment ONLY based on the availability and at the discretion of the Archivist. Walk-in research requests will NOT be accommodated. Contact the Museum for more information.

### Museum Admission Fees

The Museum offers educational experiences that showcase the county’s traditions of ingenuity, innovation, and invention – with emphasis on San Joaquin County’s singular contributions in agriculture – to promote community pride, continued learning, and an appreciation of regional history among County residents and visitors.

  * Adults (18-64)  $7
  * Senio...
admission_text:
## Become A

## Member

## Membership has its perks

As a member, you’re in the know! You’re invited to all the events, activities and new exhibits at the Museum. With your membership, you are supporting state-of-the art exhibits and the preservation of 50,000 irreplaceable historic artifacts and documents as well as award-winning programs for schoolchildren!

**Join today to make a memorable difference in California’s heartland.**

_When making your membership purchase, please allow 2-5 business days for processing and mailing._

As a member, you’re in the know! You’re invited to all the events, activates and new exhibits at the Museum. With your membership, you are supporting state-of-the art exhibits and the preservation of 50,000 irreplaceable historic artifacts and documents as well as award-winning programs for schoolchildren!

Join today to make a memorable difference in California’s heartland.

### MEMBERSHIP BENEFITS

  * __ Admission to the Museum
  * __ Parking at Micke Grove Regional Park
  * __ Use of Museum Research Library and Archives   
(by appointment)
  * __ San Joaquin Historian publication and newsletter
  * __ Quarterly historical presentations and lectures at Society meetings
  * __ Invitations to exclusive exhibit openings and activities
  * __ 10% discount at the Museum Mercantile Gift and Book Shop

### SOME OF THE MEMBERSHIP BENEFITS

## WE WELCOME YOU

## To Take a Step Back In Time With us

The San Joaquin County Historical Museum reveals the rich heritage of the region, from the Miwok and Yokuts Indians, to the development of modern agriculture and to Charles Weber – the founder of Stockton and the first farmer in the area. Nestled on 18-acres in beautiful Micke Grove Regional Park, the atmosphere and the charm of the Museum encourages friendly family outings, picnic lunches and strolls through our many exhibits and buildings while you gain valuable knowledge of the rich history of San Joaquin County. The Museum offers educational experiences that showcase the county’s traditions of ingenuity, innovation, and invention – with emphasis on San Joaquin County’s singular contributions in agriculture – to promote community pride, continued learning, and an appreciation of regional history among County residents and visitors. 

## Your Donation

## Will help students, individuals, and families to continue enjoying the vast historical stories and collections at the museum. 

[ DONATE Now ](https://sanjoaquinhistory.org/join-and-support/donate/)
